title: Patrik Sandell
text:
Patrik Sandell (born April 21, 1982) is a <a href="rallying">rally</a> driver from Sweden. Sandell won the <a href="Swedish%20Junior%20Championship">Swedish Junior Championship</a> in 2004 and the <a href="Swedish%20Group%20N3%20Championship">Swedish Group N3 Championship</a> in 2005. In 2006, he won the <a href="Junior%20World%20Rally%20Championship">Junior World Rally Championship</a> (JWRC) title driving for <a href="Renault">Renault</a>. In <a href="2008%20World%20Rally%20Championship%20season">2008</a>, Sandell contested both the JWRC and the <a href="Production%20World%20Rally%20Championship">Production World Rally Championship</a> (PWRC).
Sandell joined Olsbergs MSE to drive a Ford Fiesta at the <a href="Global%20RallyCross%20Championship">Global RallyCross Championship</a> in 2013. He finished 6th in the standings, scoring two podiums. In 2014 he won a race and finished in the overall championship in 6th place. He joined <a href="Bryan%20Herta%20Rallysport">Bryan Herta Rallysport</a> in 2015, driving with sponsorship from <a href="Kobalt%20Tools">Kobalt Tools</a>.
Biography.
Sandell’s interest in motorsport came as a teenager. He was 16 when he first tried rallycross, and 17 when he ran his first rally. Sandell won his first championship in 2004 when he won the Swedish Junior Championship, and won the Swedish Group N3 title in 2005.
In 2006, Sandell contested the <a href="Junior%20World%20Rally%20Championship">Junior World Rally Championship</a> and won the title with a win and three podiums in six starts. Over the next few years, he would continue racing in the JWRC, <a href="Production%20World%20Rally%20Championship">Production World Rally Championship</a>, and <a href="Super%202000%20World%20Rally%20Championship">Super 2000 World Rally Championship</a>, earning victories in all three classes. Sandell became a <a href="Red%20Bull">Red Bull</a> athlete in 2009 and won his first two PWRC starts that year in <a href="2009%20Rally%20Norway">Norway</a> and <a href="2009%20Cyprus%20Rally">Cyprus</a>.
In 2012, Sandell made his debut with the <a href="Prodrive%20WRC%20Team">Mini WRC Team</a> at his native <a href="Rally%20Sweden">2012 Rally Sweden</a> and finished a career-best eighth. Mini parent <a href="BMW">BMW</a> later terminated its contract with <a href="Prodrive">Prodrive</a>, and Sandell no longer raced in WRC after the 2012 season.
For 2013, Sandell moved to the <a href="Global%20RallyCross%20Championship">Global RallyCross Championship</a> and joined <a href="Olsbergs%20MSE">Olsbergs MSE</a>. He earned his first podium in his first GRC start at <a href="X%20Games">X Games Brazil</a>, and finished the year sixth in points. He replicated that result in 2014, also earning his first career win in a race at <a href="Robert%20F.%20Kennedy%20Memorial%20Stadium">RFK Stadium</a> that June.
In 2015, Sandell switched to the new <a href="Bryan%20Herta%20Autosport">Bryan Herta Rallysport</a> team. Sandell would spend the <a href="2015%20Global%20RallyCross%20Championship">2015</a> and <a href="2016%20Global%20RallyCross%20Championship">2016</a> seasons with the team, winning once each year.
Sandell accepted a new drive with <a href="Subaru%20Rally%20Team%20USA">Subaru Rally Team USA</a> for 2017 and finished eighth in points. He earned his first podium of the season in the first Atlantic City round. In 2018, Sandell continued to compete for the team in the newly established <a href="2018%20Americas%20Rallycross%20Championship">Americas Rallycross</a> series, where he finished third in points. Sandell also returned to stage rally for three <a href="American%20Rally%20Association">American Rally Association</a> events in 2018, winning all three.
Sandell will continue to compete in Americas Rallycross for the newly rebranded Subaru Motorsports team in 2019.
